intro: Ageratina cremasta, commonly known as the whiteleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in shades of white and blue, and bloom during the rainy season. Ageratina cremasta is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
